thread.title: Texas defense befuddles OU in 24-17 upset
thread.title_full: Texas defense befuddles OU in 24-17 upset

author:
Matt Marinez 
Star-Telegram Staff Writer
title: Texas defense befuddles OU in 24-17 upset
text:
Texas defense befuddles OU in 24-17 upset 
By Matt Marinez Order Reprint of this Story DALLAS 
The Texas defense sacked Baker Mayfied six times, including on a 3rd-and-14 play with under four minutes to play and the Soooners trailing 24-17. The Longhorns were able to hang on after going up 14-0 early, on a 24-yard shovel pass from Jerrod Heard to Marcus Johnson followed by a Kirk Johnson special teams fumble recovery that led to a short field and a 2-yard rushing touchdown by Tyrone Swoopes. 
Texas put two rushers over 100 yards in the win. Heard ran for 115 yards on 21 carries while freshman D’Onta Foreman carried it nine times for 117 yards, including an 81-yard fourth-quarter run that set up Swoopes’ 2-yard touchdown pass to tight end and converted defensive lineman Caleb Bluiett that put Texas ahead 24-10. 
Freshman linebacker and Mesquite Poteet product Malik Jefferson recorded two sacks in the upset win that seemed so improbable after the Longhorns’ 50-7 loss last week at TCU. 
Players of the game: Foreman was the stronger of Texas’ two running backs all afternoon, as he has been for most of the season. Though he did not reach the end zone, his 81-yard run early in the fourth was the longest by a Longhorn in the 110 meetings between Texas and OU. Tyrone Swoopes was used in a power goalline package and was responsible for two of Texas’ scores. 
Records: Oklahoma 4-1, 1-1 Big 12; Texas 2-4, 1-2 Related content
